intro: Brachystelma exile, commonly known as the slender stone orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, often hairy growth habit. The plant produces delicate, pale green or white flowers with a distinctive, spurred shape typical of many orchids. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
